ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You will learn a lot and have an appropriate amount of work.
I would highly recommend it for those interested in this topic.

The course examined the cognitive science of theory of mind from a comparative perspective. The course examines research on primate and infant behavior and examines neuroscientific approaches. I would recommend it to anyone researching these topics.

I would summarize PSYC 671 as an in depth exploration of theory of mind. I would recommend the course to any student who is really interested in theory of mind. There is a good amount of reading each week, but it is easy to get through if you have a vested interest in the subject.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learned the core literature of the field.

I felt that I achieved working proficiency in the literature of Theory of Mind, and therefore that I could contribute to the literature. This helps with my own research, which I believe overlaps tangentially with this literature, I think by being able to pull in more insight from this line of work it will strengthen my theoretical perspective.
This course got me thinking in new ways and about different questions.
The course provides a great opportunity to explore open questions and pursue them in our own labs.
